alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:38PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Furnas. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms earlier Sunday evening dropped heavy rain of generally 1 to 3 inches in far southwestern and south central Furnas County, along and a few miles north of the Norton County line. Minor flooding could still be ongoing tonight in parts of the Advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sappa Creek, Dry Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of far southwestern and south central Furnas County, including along the Sappa Creek where it flows out of Norton County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
